== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Kantner was born on March 17, 1941, in San Francisco, California, the son of Cora Lee (Fortier) and Paul Schell Kantner.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Kantner had a half-brother and a half-sister by his father's first marriage, both much older than he.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His father was of German descent, and his mother was of French and German ancestry.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His mother died when he was eight years old, and Kantner remembered that he was not allowed to attend her funeral; his father sent him to the circus instead.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After his mother's death, his father, who was a traveling salesman, sent young Kantner to Catholic military boarding school.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: At the age of eight or nine, in the school's library, he read his first science fiction book, finding an escape by immersing himself in science fiction and music from then on.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: As a teenager he went into total revolt against all forms of authority, and he decided to become a protest folk singer in the manner of his musical hero, Pete Seeger.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After graduating from Saint Mary's College High School, he attended the University of Santa Clara (where he first befriended classmate Jorma Kaukonen) and San Jose State College, completing three years of coursework before dropping out to enter the music scene.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: For a while, he shared a communal house in Venice, Los Angeles with several other folk singers who would subsequently transition to rock, including David Crosby and David Freiberg.

== Death ==

sentences: Death ==
section: == Death ==

sentences: Kantner died in San Francisco at the age of 74 on January 28, 2016, from multiple organ failure and septic shock after he suffered a heart attack days earlier.
section: == Death ==

sentences: Shortly after Kantner's death, Grateful Dead drummer Mickey Hart called Kantner the band’s backbone and said Kantner should have received the kind of credit that Slick, Casady and Kaukonen received.
section: == Death ==

sentences: Coincidentally, he died on the same day as Airplane co-founder Signe Toly Anderson.
section: == Death ==
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Kantner had three children: sons Gareth (a restaurateur) and Alexander (a musician who sometimes played with Jefferson Starship and now high school English teacher), and daughter China (a former MTV VJ and actress).
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: After joining the late 1960s San Francisco rock scene's exodus to suburban Marin County by briefly relocating to Bolinas, California in the early 1970s, he decided to return to San Francisco as the Jefferson Starship era dawned, residing for many years in "a beautiful house perched over the blue Pacific in the ritzy Sea Cliff neighborhood."
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Later in life, he moved to North Beach, where he frequented the original Caffe Trieste.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: A lifelong cigarette smoker (with a penchant for unfiltered Camels) throughout his adult life, Kantner prophetically stated in a late-in-life interview, "I'm not going to give up the few things I enjoy.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Might as well die of something I like."
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Identifying as a political anarchist, Kantner advocated the use of entheogens such as LSD for mind expansion and spiritual growth, and was a prominent advocate of the legalization of marijuana, which he regularly consumed for most of his adult life.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In a 1986 interview, Kantner shared his thoughts about cocaine and alcohol, saying, "Cocaine, particularly, is a bummer.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: It's a noxious drug that turns people into jerks.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: And alcohol is probably the worst drug of all.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As you get older and accomplish more things in life in general, you realize that drugs don't help, particularly if you abuse them."
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: When Kantner suffered a cerebral hemorrhage in 1980, his attending physician at Cedars-Sinai, Stephen Levy, was quick to point out it was not a drug-related issue, saying: "There is zero relationship between Paul's illness and drugs.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He doesn't use drugs.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: "Belying his reputation as a near-teetotaler during the commercial heyday of Jefferson Airplane and Jefferson Starship, Kantner began to use alcohol more frequently in his later years, with bandmate Jude Gold ultimately characterizing Kantner's vodka intake as an "on-again/off-again love affair."
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In a 2016 reminiscence, Marty Balin reflected on this period: "It was sad to see.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He didn't do anything to take care of his health with all his drinking and everything, smoking cigarettes all the time, pushing himself too much.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He asked me to join him for this last go-round.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He'd been touring around the world and I talked to him and said, 'You better be careful.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Take care of yourself.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: You've got a grueling schedule.'
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He just said, 'Don't worry about me.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: I can do anything.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: I'm strong as a bull.'
